ygData.messageBody:
Hey all,

I guess my opinion on this Harm Touch thing is I don't think
anyone's getting shafted. EQ has been extremely well balanced from what
I've seen and half the fun for me is taking a game that's designed a
certain way and finding my own ways of dealing with whatever hardships
I'm presented with. I feel like trying to ask the dev team at this point
to make the game easier for me is pretty weak. That was the point of the
beta. Part of the reason I bought the game was because it seemed like a
challenge during the beta and a game that is challenging is much more
interesting than one that is easily mastered.

I also heard a story about people complaining about the Sand Giants at the
Oasis saying they were interfering with their play. My feeling about that
issue is: duh! thats what they're there for. I felt like those people
were whining too much. And while the issue of balance is a better issue
to discuss than how to blatantly make the game easier, I still feel that
it's slightly whiny to complain about a character that is intentionally
more difficult at the lower levels. Let's face it, at the highest levels,
we're going to be the most powerful players in the game. Wizards will be
able to do more quick damage, but in a long run fight, SKs are the only
ones that can dish it out AND take it. And if there's any such thing as a
soloable character at high levels (which I doubt), SKs are going to be the
closest thing to it.

So my perspective is to leave the HT alone and rise to the challenges that
the designers gave us. After all, we did choose our characters.

Oogog


************************************************************************
Always remember to pillage BEFORE you burn.
************************************************************************

On Mon, 26 Apr 1999, Countess Bathory wrote:

> From: Countess Bathory <countess_bathory_69@...>
>
> I fully admit, and am glad for it, that SKs will indeed be a class to
> be reckoned with.
>
> However i must stick with my previous comments on HT. Sure if a few SKs
> got together and HT'd a Griffon to death quick and easy, they would get
> good exp. But that would be it for another hour and a half. If thats
> what they want to do with their HT instead of keeping it for an
> emergency where HT is the only thing that'll save them, thats up to the
> individuals involved. Its not like they'll be able to walk around and
> HT everything to death right after that.
>
> And as for LoH getting interrupted, i have heard this about HT,
> although its never happened to me.
> I would like to hear from any SK on this.
> If this is true, then we're back to square one. LoH 1000 healing, HT
> 500dmg, but resisted by the creatures you would actually use it
> against.
>
> And we all know that a toning down of LoH just isn't going to happen.
> We could campaign the rest of our lives and it'll never even be
> considered.
> So what's left?
> Tweak HT.
> HT is only powerful WHEN it works. Which seems to be less and less as
> we gain higher levels and fight bigger creatures.
>
> And i still feel that it should work every time.
>
> But aside from our differences of opinion, i would like to hear what
> you think would be a good way to get the Dev team's attention with our
> various concerns.
>
> Talking about these topics on message boards and mailing lists is OK,
> but this wont accomplish anything as far as the game is concerned.
> Lets do that pro-active thing i hear so much about.
>
> Thanks for responding,
>
> Bathory
> Cazic-Thule
>

> > than paladins.. by the time

> > fully capable of beating
> > the snot out of a lvl 50 paladin in his best
> > equipment. (also, we dont have
> > to kill the lava dragon for a darkreaver ;)) upon

> >

> > i try very hard not to

> >

> > paladins cant hit worth a damn,
